intro: Crepinella suaveolens, commonly known as the sweet-scented crepinella, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, yellowish to white florets arranged in a disc-like structure, surrounded by pale green to reddish bracts. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Its fragrant foliage and unique floral structure make it an interesting subject for botanical study and ornamental gardening.
